intro: Neodissochaeta, commonly known as the "false sandmat," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. The plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and are adapted to thrive in dry conditions. Neodissochaeta species usually have alternate leaves that are linear to ovate in shape. They are often used in traditional medicine and are of interest in botanical research due to their unique adaptations to harsh environments.
